newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: KLASCO TO BOOST SHARE CAPITAL.
newsitem.headline: KLASCO TO BOOST SHARE CAPITAL.

text.p: Lithuanian Prime Minister Gediminas Vagnorius said on Thursday that the government had decided to boost the share capital of the state-run Klaipeda Stevedoring Company (KLASCO) by over 120 million litas.
The prime minister also told Reuters after a news conference that the share capital boost would come from the company's profit reserves.
The company's share capital is currently 128.9 million litas.
The company, which is the largest stevedoring firm in Lithuania, is 90 percent state-owned and is slated for privatisation.
The government recently said that it plans later this month to announce a bid for a consultant to draw up a privatisation plan for the company.
The company accounts for around 60 percent of cargo volumes at the port of Klaipeda.
